english: to finish;to understand;to be able to;to end

etymology.description: pictogram: baby without arms; Shuowen says “crossing of lower legs,” Shuowen Jiezi Zhu says entangled legs; “finish” likely a sound loan; unrelated to 亨.
etymology.interpretation: Earliest graphs depict an infant with crossed or tangled legs, a simple pictorial form later repurposed in use. Verbal senses like “to finish/understand/be able to” developed via sound loan, while the original image survives only in historical explanations.

examples.chinese: 我终于了结了这件事(我終於了結了這件事)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ zhōngyú liǎojié le zhè jiàn shì.

examples.chinese: 他对历史很了解(他對歷史很了解)。
我们解决不了这个问题(我們解決不了這個問題)。
